sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"战斗，战争"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: battle, war, campaign, struggle, warfare, fight, combat, engagement
means: battle ： 侧重指战争中的一次较全面、时间较长的战斗，也指陆军或海军在某一特定地区进行的战斗，或个人之间的争斗。
war ： 是战争的总称，一般指包括多个战役的大规模战争。
campaign ： 通常指在一场大的战争中在某一地区进行的一连串有既定目的的军事行动。也可作引申用。
struggle ： 指激烈或时间持续长的战斗或奋力斗争。
warfare ： 侧重指战争状态或具体的作战方法。
fight ： 最普通用词，含义广，指战斗、斗争或打斗。
combat ： 泛指军事行动，尤指小规模的战斗，甚至是格斗。

sentence.Network_en: At times party rivalries have broken out into open warfare.

entry.def: Warfare is the activity of fighting a war.
Warfare is sometimes used to refer to any violent struggle or conflict.

example.ex: Much of the violence is related to drugs and gang warfare...
example.tran: 大多数暴力事件都与吸毒和群殴有关。

example.ex: At times party rivalries have broken out into open warfare.
example.tran: 政党间的矛盾有时爆发为公开的冲突。

means.word_mean: 1. the waging of armed conflict against an enemy;

sentences.sentence: "thousands of people were killed in the war"

means.word_mean: 2. an active struggle between competing entities;

Sentence.sentence: They had titles like Young vs Old, Gray Dawn and The Coming Generational Storm, and their message was blunt: health-care systems were heading for the rocks, pensioners were taking young people to the cleaners, and soon there would be intergenerational warfare.
Nor is there any sign of the intergenerational warfare predicted in the 1990s
The predicted intergenerational warfare is unlikely because most of the older people themselves mostly have families.

sentences.en: They are waging warfare with drought.

jushi.english: He addressed the audience on the subject of atomic warfare.
jushi.chinese: 他向听众讲了有关核战争问题。

jushi.english: Celerity is the soul of warfare.
A regional conflict would erupt into violent warfare.
jushi.chinese: 地区性冲突会演变成一场大战。
